page.title: 08MIDDLETON
page.content: MIDDLETON IS A SMALL VILLAGE WITH A DEFINITE NUCLEUS UNLIKE OST OF THE OTHER VILLAGES IN THE AREA WHICH TEND TO BE SCATTERED WITH SETTLEMENTS AROUND MANOR HOUSES & FARMS. BECAUSE IT ADJOINS SUDBURY THERE HAS NOT BEEN THE DROP IN POPULATION (157 IN 1981,183 IN 1871) THAT OTHER MORE DISTANT AGRICULTURAL VILLAGES HAVE UNDERGONE.A NUMBER OF HOUSES HAVE GONE UP SINCE THE WAR BUT NO ESTATES. THERE IS NO SHOP OR BUS SERVICE.THE INHABITAMTS VERY MUCH RELY ON THEIR CARS.FEW WERE BORN IN THE VILLAGE AND MOST WORK ELSEWHERE.THE JOBS THAT EXIST ARE ON THE FARMS AND IN THE LARGE TURKEY PROCESSING PLANT.THE CHURCH HAS A NUMBER OF NORMAN FEATURES.THERE ARE GOOD VIEWS ACROSS THE STOUR TO SUFFOLK.
